contest-event.event-date:
Sept. 4, 1893 D Belle Vue September Contest
British Open 1 Test Piece Contest
british-open
Elaine
Belle Vue, Manchester, Greater Manchester, England, UK Prizes:
1st: £30 in cash, a patent clear bore euphonium, four valves, electro-plated and richly engraved, in leather case complete, value 22 guineas, present by Joseph Higham. Gold medal, value 4 guineas, presented by Wright & Round, Three silver trophies one each to cornet, trombone and euphonium, presented by Silvani & Smith. The Belle Vue Champion Silver Challenge Cup, value 50 guineas. The Samson-Fox Champion Silver Challenge Cup, value 50 guineas. Gold medal, value 3 guineas, given by Mr Jennison, making a total value of £165 9s.
2nd: £25 in cash, a "Victory" euphonium value £21 1s, presented by F. Besson, also medal value 3 guineas presented by Mr Jennison, total value £49 4s
3rd: £20 in cash and an Eb soprano value 10 guineas, presented by Silvani & Smith, also Gold medal value 3 guineas, presented by Mr Jennison. Total value £33 13s
4th: £12 in cash, a Bb Tenor Slide Trombone value 13 guineas, presented by Joseph Higham, also Gold medal value 3 guineas, presented by Mr Jennison. Total value £21 16s
5th: £8 in cash, a patent leather cross belt and special belt for bandmaster, with engraved and patent buckle, value 6 guineas, presented by Mr A. Pounder, also Gold medal value 3 guineas, presented by Mr Jennison. Total value £17 9s
6th: £5 in cash and also Gold medal value 3 guineas, presented by Mr Jennison. Total value £8 3s
7th special prize, silver plated and engraved cornet, value £13, present by Boosey & Co.
July 5, 2011, 7:36 p.m. Oct. 26, 2014, 10:22 a.m.
